welcome.title: Choose Your Project
welcome.description: Select a project from the sidebar to start coding with Claude. Each project contains your chat sessions and file history.
welcome.tipDesktop: Create a new project by clicking the folder icon in the sidebar
welcome.tipMobile: Tap the menu button above to access projects

chat.placeholder: Type / for commands, @ for files, or ask {{provider}} anything...
chat.usageLimitReached: Claude usage limit reached. Your limit will reset at **{{time}} {{timezone}}** - {{date}}
chat.noMessages: No messages yet. Start a conversation!

onboarding.gitConfigDesc: Set up your git identity for commits
onboarding.gitConfigDetail: Configure your git identity to ensure proper attribution for your commits
onboarding.gitNameHelp: This will be used as: git config --global user.name
onboarding.gitEmailHelp: This will be used as: git config --global user.email
onboarding.claudeCLIDetail: Connect your Claude account to enable AI-powered coding features
onboarding.cursorCLIDetail: Connect your Cursor account to enable AI-powered features
onboarding.loginInstructions: Click the button below to authenticate with {{provider}}. A terminal will open with authentication instructions.
onboarding.optional: This step is optional. You can skip and configure it later in Settings.
onboarding.errorRequired: Both git name and email are required
onboarding.errorInvalidEmail: Please enter a valid email address

auth.title: Authentication
auth.signIn: Sign in to your Claude account to enable AI features
auth.signInCursor: Sign in to your Cursor account to enable AI features

permissions.title: Permission Settings
permissions.skipPromptsDescCursor: Equivalent to -f flag in Cursor CLI

tools.allowedDesc: Tools that are automatically allowed without prompting for permission
tools.disallowedDesc: Tools that are automatically blocked without prompting for permission

cursor.allowedCommandsDesc: Shell commands that are automatically allowed without prompting for permission
cursor.disallowedCommandsDesc: Shell commands that should always be denied

mcp.title: MCP Servers
mcp.description: Model Context Protocol servers provide additional tools and data sources to Claude

apiKeys.title: API Keys
apiKeys.description: Generate API keys to access the external API from other applications.
apiKeys.saveWarningDetail: This is the only time you'll see this key. Store it securely.
apiKeys.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this API key?

githubCredentials.title: GitHub Credentials
githubCredentials.description: Add GitHub Personal Access Tokens to clone private repositories. You can also pass tokens directly in API requests without storing them.
githubCredentials.howToCreate: How to create a GitHub Personal Access Token ‚Üí
githubCredentials.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this GitHub token?

git.title: Git Configuration
git.name: Git Name
git.description: Configure your git identity for commits. These settings will be applied globally.
git.autoCommitDesc: Automatically commit changes when saving files

appearance.darkModeDesc: Toggle between light and dark themes
appearance.projectSortingDesc: How projects are ordered in the sidebar
appearance.editorThemeDesc: Default theme for the code editor
appearance.wordWrapDesc: Wrap long lines in the code editor
appearance.showMinimapDesc: Display minimap in the code editor
appearance.lineNumbersDesc: Show line numbers in the code editor
appearance.fontSizeDesc: Default font size for the code editor

quickSettings.title: Quick Settings
quickSettings.sendByCtrlEnterDesc: When enabled, pressing Ctrl+Enter will send the message instead of just Enter. This is useful for IME users to avoid accidental sends.

notInstalled.title: TaskMaster AI CLI Not Installed
notInstalled.description: TaskMaster CLI is required to use task management features. Install it to get started:
notInstalled.step2: TaskMaster features will automatically become available
notInstalled.step3: Use task-master init in your project directory

tasksSettings.enableDesc: Show TaskMaster tasks, banners, and sidebar indicators across the interface

git.title: Git
git.selectProject: Select a project to view source control
git.noCommitsDesc: This repository doesn't have any commits yet. Create your first commit to start tracking changes.
git.gitTip: Run git init in your project directory to initialize git source control.
git.branchFromCurrent: This will create a new branch from the current branch ({{branch}})

tasks.title: Tasks
tasks.descriptionPlaceholder: Describe what you want to accomplish...

codeEditor.title: Code Editor
codeEditor.shortcuts: Press Ctrl+S to save ‚Ä¢ Esc to close

generateModal.title: Generate Tasks from PRD
generateModal.proTipTitle: üí° Pro Tip: Ask Claude Code Directly!
generateModal.proTipDesc: You can simply ask Claude Code in the chat to parse your PRD and generate tasks. The AI assistant will automatically save your PRD and create detailed tasks with implementation details.
generateModal.willDo: This will: Save your PRD, analyze its content, and generate structured tasks with subtasks, dependencies, and implementation details.
generateModal.learnMore: For more examples and advanced usage patterns:
generateModal.gotIt: Got it, I'll ask Claude Code directly

overwriteModal.title: File Already Exists
overwriteModal.message: A PRD file named "{{fileName}}" already exists. Do you want to overwrite it with the current content?

errors.networkError: Network error. Please check your connection.
errors.serverError: Server error. Please try again later.
errors.invalidInput: Invalid input. Please check your data.

projectWizard.title: Create New Project
projectWizard.chooseTypeQuestion: Do you already have a workspace, or would you like to create a new one?
projectWizard.existingWorkspaceDesc: I already have a workspace on my server and just need to add it to the project list
projectWizard.newWorkspaceDesc: Create a new workspace, optionally clone from a GitHub repository
projectWizard.whereCreateWorkspace: Where should the workspace be created?
projectWizard.existingPathHint: Full path to your existing workspace directory
projectWizard.newPathHint: Full path where the new workspace will be created
projectWizard.githubUrlHint: Leave empty to create an empty workspace, or provide a GitHub URL to clone
projectWizard.githubAuthHint: Only required for private repositories. Public repos can be cloned without authentication.
projectWizard.tokenForOperation: This token will be used only for this operation
projectWizard.publicRepoTip: üí° Public repositories don't require authentication. You can skip providing a token if cloning a public repo.
projectWizard.noStoredTokensHint: No stored tokens available. You can add tokens in Settings ‚Üí API Keys for easier reuse.
projectWizard.confirmExistingMsg: The workspace will be added to your project list and will be available for Claude/Cursor sessions.
projectWizard.confirmNewGithubMsg: A new workspace will be created and the repository will be cloned from GitHub.
projectWizard.confirmNewEmptyMsg: An empty workspace directory will be created at the specified path.
projectWizard.selectTypeError: Please select whether you have an existing workspace or want to create a new one

setupForm.welcomeDesc: Set up your account to get started
setupForm.usernameTooShort: Username must be at least 3 characters long
setupForm.passwordTooShort: Password must be at least 6 characters long
setupForm.singleUserNote: This is a single-user system. Only one account can be created.

login.signInToAccount: Sign in to your Claude Code UI account
login.enterCredentials: Enter your credentials to access Claude Code UI
login.errorBothRequired: Please enter both username and password

errorBoundary.errorOccurred: An error occurred while loading the chat interface.

createTask.title: Create AI-Generated Task
createTask.proTipTitle: üí° Pro Tip: Ask Claude Code Directly!
createTask.proTipDesc: You can simply ask Claude Code in the chat to create tasks for you. The AI assistant will automatically generate detailed tasks with research-backed insights.
createTask.examplePrompt: "Please add a new task to implement user profile image uploads using Cloudinary, research the best approach."
createTask.learnMore: For more examples and advanced usage patterns:
createTask.gotIt: Got it, I'll ask Claude Code directly

apiKeysSettings.githubTokensDesc: Add GitHub Personal Access Tokens to clone private repositories via the external API.
apiKeysSettings.externalApiDocDesc: Learn how to use the external API to trigger Claude/Cursor sessions from your applications.

versionUpdate.upgradeCommand: git checkout main && git pull && npm install
versionUpdate.upgradeHint: Or click "Update Now" to run the update automatically.
versionUpdate.restartHint: Please restart the server to apply changes.

taskList.tryAdjustingFilters: Try adjusting your search or filter criteria.

kanban.emptyDefault: Tasks with this status will appear here

notConfigured.title: TaskMaster AI is not configured
notConfigured.description: TaskMaster helps break down complex projects into manageable tasks with AI-powered assistance

features.aiPoweredDesc: Break complex projects into manageable subtasks
features.prdTemplatesDesc: Generate tasks from Product Requirements Documents
features.dependencyDesc: Understand task relationships and execution order
features.progressDesc: Kanban boards and detailed task analytics
features.cliDesc: Use taskmaster commands for advanced workflows

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started with TaskMaster
gettingStarted.subtitle: TaskMaster is initialized! Here's what to do next:
gettingStarted.tip: Start with a PRD to get the most out of TaskMaster's AI-powered task generation

step1.title: Create a Product Requirements Document (PRD)
step1.desc: Discuss your project idea and create a PRD that describes what you want to build.

step2.title: Generate Tasks from PRD
step2.desc: Once you have a PRD, ask your AI assistant to parse it and TaskMaster will automatically break it down into manageable tasks with implementation details.

step3.title: Analyze & Expand Tasks
step3.desc: Ask your AI assistant to analyze task complexity and expand them into detailed subtasks for easier implementation.

step4.title: Start Building
step4.desc: Ask your AI assistant to begin working on tasks, update their status, and add new tasks as your project evolves.

setupModal.title: TaskMaster Setup
setupModal.subtitle: Interactive CLI for {{project}}
setupModal.completed: TaskMaster setup completed! You can now close this window.

helpModal.title: Getting Started with TaskMaster
helpModal.subtitle: Your guide to productive task management
helpModal.viewMoreExamples: View more examples and usage patterns ‚Üí

step1.title: Create a Product Requirements Document (PRD)
step1.desc: Discuss your project idea and create a PRD that describes what you want to build.

step2.title: Generate Tasks from PRD
step2.desc: Once you have a PRD, ask your AI assistant to parse it and TaskMaster will automatically break it down into manageable tasks with implementation details.
step2.example: I've just initialized a new project with Claude Task Master. I have a PRD at .taskmaster/docs/prd.txt. Can you help me parse it and set up the initial tasks?

step3.title: Analyze & Expand Tasks
step3.desc: Ask your AI assistant to analyze task complexity and expand them into detailed subtasks for easier implementation.
step3.example: Task 5 seems complex. Can you break it down into subtasks?

step4.title: Start Building
step4.desc: Ask your AI assistant to begin working on tasks, update their status, and add new tasks as your project evolves.
step4.example: Please add a new task to implement user profile image uploads using Cloudinary, research the best approach.

proTips.title: üí° Pro Tips
proTips.tip1: Use the search bar to quickly find specific tasks
proTips.tip2: Switch between Kanban, List, and Grid views using the view toggles
proTips.tip3: Use filters to focus on specific task statuses or priorities
proTips.tip4: Click on any task to view detailed information and manage subtasks

learnMore.title: üìö Learn More
learnMore.desc: TaskMaster AI is an advanced task management system built for developers. Get documentation, examples, and contribute to the project.

aiPowered.desc: Break complex projects into manageable subtasks
